#228

- Growing in shelving clusters and as a resupinate mass on large fallen Northern Red Oak log on north-facing mixed oak/hickory woodland slope.
- Caps hirsute with light to dark violet transition at margin. Brown to gray near base with brownish hairs.
- Hymenium consisting of irregular tooth-like pores, turning light violet near margin. Some resupinate fruiting bodies developing algal component.
- Flesh tough and spongy.
- Smell: faint
- Taste: not distinctive
